channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report E-2024020147
item.description:
Report E-2024020147

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-02
  • City: SHARPSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 2, 2024, three (3) 5-gallon pails of UN1263 were punctured by a metal rod in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel found three (3) damaged 5-gallon pails, removed them from the load, and placed them into one (1) 55-gallon drum that was fitted with proper labels for return to the terminal. Crews utilized granular absorbents to collect the released product from the trailer and freight, and all spent absorbents and any cleanup debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon bucket that was taken back to the terminal by FCE personnel.

item.title: Report X-2024020336
item.description:
Report X-2024020336

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-17
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet. Package came off of trailer# 807438 already leaking/damaged. Upon inspection of inner contents 4 X 4 liter glass bottles 2-propanol. 1 out of 4 liter glass bottles of 2-propanol had a loose cap allowing 1 liter to release. The other 3 X 1 liter glass bottles of 2-propanol were not damaged. There were slotted partitions but no absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed. Contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 1 out of 4 liter glass bottles of 2-propanol had a loose cap leaking out 1 liter of contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a hazmat bag lined red tote.

item.title: Report X-2024010707
item.description:
Report X-2024010707

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-24
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING PACKAGE REWRAP FLASHLIGHTS CONTAINING LITHIUM ION BATTERIES WERE FOUND. THERE IS ONE POLYTAC X USB CONTAINING TWO RECHARGEABLE LITHIUM ION BATTERIES. ADDITIONALLY, THERE ARE FOUR VULCAN 180 FLASHLIGHTS CONTAINING LITHIUM ION BATTERIES. LASTLY, THERE ARE SIX WEDGE FLASHLIGHTS CONTAINING LITHIUM ION BATTERIES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. AN INNER BOX HAS A UN3481 LITHIUM BATTERY MARK APPLIED. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • City: MUNCY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being unloaded off the van during the outbound sort. Package handler noticed box was wet and notified management. Package was brought to QA to be processed. DescribePack: Package contained 2 2.5 gallons of low temp san. One bottle had a lid that was punctured in the middle. Unsure of what caused the puncture. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed upright and brought to QA.

item.title: Report X-2024010749
item.description:
Report X-2024010749

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet. Upon inspection of inner contents 4 X 1 gallon plastic bottles Sizzle scale remover. 1 X 1 gallon plastic bottle of Sizzle scale remover had a loose cap allowing 1 gallon to release. The other 3 X 1 gallon plastic bottles were soiled/damaged. There was a slotted partition and each individual plastic bottle was in a plastic bag but no absorbent was found. All contents inside package was damaged. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed. Contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 1 X 1 gallon of Sizzle scale remover had a loose cap leaking out all contents soiling/damaging the other 3 X 1 gallon plastic bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat package was placed inside a hazmat bag lined red tote.
